glosses: In a way that is fitting of siblings, brotherly, fraternally.

etymology: Inherited from Ottoman Turkish قارنداشجه or قرنداشجه (ḳarındaşca, ḳardaşca) from قارنداش or قرنداش (ḳarındaş, ḳardaş), equivalent to kardeş (“sibling”) + -çe. Cognates with Azerbaijani qardaşcasına, Tatar кардәшчә (qärdäşçä), Uyghur قېرىنداشلارچە (qërindashlarche), Uzbek qardoshlarcha.
